question.title: How to run Spring Boot backend and Angular frontend separately in a JHipster project?
question.body:
I am working on a JHipster project that uses Spring Boot for the backend and Angular for the frontend. I want to run the backend and frontend separately on different ports to facilitate development and debugging.

Here's what I've tried so far:

For the backend: I use ./mvnw to start the Spring Boot application on port 8080, and it works as expected. For the frontend: I use npm start to start the Angular development server on port 4200. However, when I open the frontend in the browser, I get a blank page. How can I resolve the blank page issue when running the Angular frontend separately? Backend: Spring Boot 2.0.5.RELEASE Frontend: Angular 12 JHipster: Version 5.4.1
